inn1.comm: Very good start from Mason. Right around that offstump, it landed on a length, on the offstump line before shaping away. Left alone
slightly back of a length, just outside the offstump, leans back to punch it out to cover
again angling away and he tries to go for a cut but doesn't make contact. Too close and not all that short to go for that shot
on the middle and off, pushed to the on side
in the zone outside the offstump, left alone. No flirting this time.
Mason starts off with a maiden over. This one kicks up from a length, the batsman is surprised by the extra bounce, takes off the bottom-hand out of the bat-handle, pushes it out to the offside
140kmph start. Purrfect if you are a NZ fan. Full, just outside the offstump and it whizzes away. Jayasuriya is late in getting the bat down as he tries to drive and is beaten

Bond nails Jayasuriya! What a start for NZ! Excellent delivery. It landed on a length, around the offstump line, sucking Jayasuriya into a forward prod. He had to play at it and he did. The ball shaped away, took a bit of outside edge and flew to left of McCullum who took off in the air to take a smart catch.
Outside offstump, left alone.
Again in the channel outside offstump, wee bit outside to interest Atapattu who shoulders arms
In that zone outside off again, Atapattu goes back and across, covers his offstump, leaves it alone
Second maiden. One wicket down already. Around the offstump, comes in a touch, Atapattu leans forward, stabs at it and the ball rolls away to the on side.
swing and a miss! Touch outside offstump and he has a flash at it.
Sri Lanka are away. Neat litte punch off the backfoot. Slightly short of length, bit outside off and punched past point.
sailing harmlessly outside off, left alone
beaten! very good delivery. Lands on a length, around middle and off, and bounces as it shapes away, he pushes at it, and is beaten
wild slash! No contact! Touch wide outside offstump, and Tharanga doesn't move his feet, just throws his bat at it and is beaten again.
well outside off, Tharanga lets it sail through to the 'keeper
143kmph yorker! Fast and furious on the offstump line, Atapattu gets his bat down in a hurry and keeps it out
Overthrows! Atapattu went back, pushed a length delivery towards extra cover and sets off for a quick run. Hamish Marshall has a dart at the non-striker's end, misses and it runs off to the boundary.
short of length, slanting away, Tharanga stands tall, taps it close on the offside and they rush across for a quick single
hits the deck short of length, Atapattu goes back,  rises on his toes, punches it down on the offside. Well played.
Great shot! hit on the up! Fullish, outside off, Atapattu leans forward, left-elbow high, and creams it through cover
outside off, run down to thirdman
beaten! Slightly short of length, lands outside off, shapes away and Atapattu flirts at it.
short of length, outside the offstump, kicks up a bit, Atapattu goes back and across, goes for a cut but his timing goes awry due to the extra bounce and the ball bounds away towards point
bouncer. First of the day. Ducked under.
follows it up with a fullish one, on the middle and off, Atapattu drives but takes off the bottom-hand from the bat-handle and the ball bobs away through extra cover.
outside offstump, defended towards point
Whack! Full and wide, Atapattu jumped at it, and drilled it through covers. Easy pickings

Another boundary. Atapattu is quick to pounce on anything loose today. This one was full and drifting towards leg and middle and that was enough for Atapattu to work his wrists and flick it just behind square-leg.
outside off, shortish, dabbed away to thirdman
outside offstump, Tharanga watches it sail into McCullum's gloves
fuller, in the channel outside off, left alone
146kmph, spearing in on the middle stump line, came in a touch with the angle, dabbed away to the on side
Boom! Super shot. Short and well outside off, Atapattu stands up tall, gets close to the line of the delivery and forces it past point. Violence but elegantly done. Typical Atapattu.
fuller, Atapattu goes for a drive, but doesn't get timing there and the ball rolls away towards cover

banged in short, rises up chest-high, around offstump, Atapattu stands tall, gets on top of the bounce, drops the ball close on the offside and rushes for a single. Marshall sprints in, swoops on the ball and flings himself in the air while releasing it towards the sticks but the batsmen make it in time.
Crash! Atapattu continues with his sparkling mood. Full and outside offstump and he creams it square on the offside.

Revenge! Atapattu falls after promising much more than 28. Soft dismissal. Fullish, on the legs, Atapattu flicks, in the air, and straight to the man standing behind square-leg.  He fell over a touch while trying to balance on his front foot and as a result he skewed it in the air. Atapattu is quite distraught with himself. He was looking so good out there but that's that. Sri Lanka lose their second wicket. Kumar Sangakkara is the new man in.
Banged in short, on the middle stump line,  pulled away, along the ground, to lone leg
bouncer and Tharanga ducks under
short of length, outside the offstump, dabbed away to the offside
Short of length, outside the offstump and Tharanga leans back and forces it powerfully to right of James Marshall, at cover, who makes a diving stop.
short of length, in the zone outside offstump, defended away to the offside
streaky edge to thirdman region. back-of-length delivery, lands around offstump, angles away, Sangakkara pushes at it and it flies past the second slip.
up and over! It was banged in short, outside offstump, Sangakkara, man in form, carved it over point. Deliberately hit in the air.
full in length and on the legs, caressed past square-leg.
fuller, just outside offstump, jabbed away to the offside
lands on a length, on the leg and middle, straightens and Tharanga is rapped on the thigh pad, cramped for room as the ball straightened.
inside-edge to fineleg. Short of length, outside off and Tharana tries to force it off the back foot, bat away from the body and edges it.
full in length, on the offstump line, defended off the front foot
length-delivery, lands on middle stump line, shapes away a touch, Sangakkara gets behind the line, pushes it out to the on side
slightly short of length, outside the offstump, moves away a touch, Sangakkar goes back, steers it to point and shouts 'No" to Tharanga. No chance of a run.
fuller and outside offstump, Sangakkara square-drives but straight to point
dabbed away to widish mid-off for a quick single
lands on a length, on leg and middle, moves towards middle stump, Sangakkara gets behind the line, defends down the track
.banged in short, on the middle and legstump line, Sangakkara leans back to pull, and it runs down fine. Very fine
on the middle stump line, turned towards midwicket
full in length, on middle stump line, Sangakkara gets behind the line, defends to the on side
full, on middle and leg, worked to wide mid-on
on the middle stump line, defended to the on side
slightly short of length, outside offstump, Tharanga leans back, punches it out into the cover region
beaten outside off! Length-delivery, whistling past that offstump line, Tharanga tried to play it late, in an effort to get it through the offside ring but doesn't make contact
short of length, on the hips, tucked away behind square-leg and they rush across for a quick single.
in the channel outside offstump, Sangakkara decides to let that sail through to the 'keeper

Very sharp catch by Taylor. Huge wicket. Man-in-form Sangkkara falls. Short and on the middle and leg, Sangakkara leans back and pulls. It flew low towards Taylor, at square-leg, who bent low in front of him to scoop the ball inches above the ground.
146 kmph bouncer! Rears over the right shoulder, Tharanga just about manages to duck under that ripper.
short of length, on the offstump line, pushed to cover
attempted yorker turns into low full-toss, on the offstump line, Tharanga got his bat down, opened its face and drove it square past point.
full in length, on the leg and middle, worked to square-leg
144kmph at the ribs, Tharanga takes the bottom-hand out, stabs at it and the ball drops in front of him ..
Again. 143 kmph. At the ribs again, Tharanga hops back, and gets on top of the bounce and drops it in front of him. Pretty well played.
Teases the outside edge. Full in length, lands outside the offstump, sucking Mahela into a forward prod and the ball straigthens and he ends up pushing down the wrong line.
around the offstump again, defended with the full-face of the bat this time.
drifts towards hips, tucked behind square-leg
length-delivery, just outside the offstump, Tharanga pushes at it with a closed-face of the bat and the ball rolls away to the on side

What a acrobatic catch by McCullum! New Zealand are right on top here. IT was banged in short, down the legside, Tharanga goes for a pull and the ball runs off the face of the bat and it could well have been a four if not for McCullum. He flung himself to his right, like a goalkeeper, to pull off a stunner. Super catch that. And Sri Lanka slip into further trouble.

Mason nails another victim! He is on fire here. Cons  the batsman with slight change of pace. Short of length and Chamara de Silva just went through the line, on the up but only ended up patting it back to Mason who bent low, in front, to take a simple catch. New Zealand are all over Sri Lanka like a rash. Especially Mason.
outside offstump, left alone
And again. Testing Jayawardene outside off, but the captain is no mood to flirt with danger. He leaves it alone.
Same line, same result.
Deja-vu at Jade stadium. Gillespie continues to tease Jayawardene outside offstump and he keeps letting them go to the 'keeper
You guessed it right. Another one sailing through the channel, to McCullum
full in length, around the offstump line, Dilshan leans forward, head over the ball and defends
Bang! short of length and Dilshan rocks back to pull it in front of square-leg.
fuller, and outside off, Dilshan leans forward, to the pitch of the delivery, pushes it out to covers
short of length, forced to cover
outside offstump, left alone. No ball though
Good slower one draws a false shot from Dilshan. Loops outside offstump, Dilshan drives, too early and gets a inside-edge that takes the ball down to fineleg
outside the offstump, left alone

Sri Lanka sink into deeper crisis. Jayawardene is run out. Vettori is the man with the throw. Dilshan dabs a length-delivery towards midwicket and sets off for a single. Vettori moved to his right at midwicket, got down swiftly on to the ball and released it quickly. It was bang on the target and Jayawardene was just caught short of the crease
bouncer, outside the offstump, swayed away
fuller and in the zone outside off, left alone
slash and a miss. Slightly short of length, outside offstump, tries to hit it on the up and is beaten
on the hips, coming in with the angle, Maharoof tries to work it to the on side, doesn't make contact and is rapped on the thigh pad
fullish, outside off, jabbed away to the offside
outside the offstump, left alone
on a length, outside the offstump,  worked to square-leg, wants a single, but is sent back by Maharoof as Taylor swoops in. And Dilshan makes it back in time
beaten outside offstump. Comprehensively. A no-ball though.
fullish, outside offstump, driven to right of Vettori at  mid-off who makes a tumbling stop
Now Maharoof gets beaten with a delivery angling away
Similar line but Maharoof judges the line better this time and shoulders arms
again angled across, wee bit wider, left alone
hits the deck short of length, lands outside off, comes in a touch, bounces a bit, punched to the offside
New Zealand continue to field brilliantly. Overpitched outside off and driven to left of extra cover where Bond makes a good diving stop
dug in short, outside off, Dilshan shapes to pull but pulls out. Good decision as he would have had to fetch it from outside offstump and that is always risky
Flirting with danger. Length-delivery, in the channel outside off, Dilshan tries to go through the line, on the up and is beaten
fuller, outside offstump, driven to cover
full in length, lands outside off, angles further away, Maharoof covers his offstump, shoulders arms.
edge to thirdman. Full and outside off, Maharoof goes for a drive, outside edge and the ball flies down to thirdman
full and outside offstump, driven to sweeper cover
plays and misses. In the channel outside offstump and Maharoof ends up pushing down the wrong line.
in the zone again, left alone
around offstump line, defended off the front foot
right up there, outside off, driven straight to cover
Dilshan breaks free. full in length, on the middle stump line, driven past the bowler.
short of length, Gillespie drags back the length after being driven down the ground, Dilshan pushes it out into covers
banged in short, just outside offstump, Dilshan swivels to pull it down on to the ground and past midwicket
almost edged behind. Banged in short and in that zone outside offstump, Maharoof hangs his bat and nearly hung himself dry. The ball whizzes past the outside edge and into McCullum's gloves
Full and in the channel outside off, left alone
And again. Franklin will keep testing the batsmen in that line.
He does it again. Left alone again. Sri Lanka need to claw their way back here. Some conservative cricket would do them good.
Again, pings the zone outside off, Dilshan leaves it all alone
on the offstump line,  defended away towards extra cover.
lands on middle, angles away, defended off the front foot. Another tight over comes to an end. Maiden in fact.
Overpitched outside offstump, driven to left of Bond, at wide mid-on, who dives to make a half-stop.
Super shot! Short of length, just outside offstump, Maharoof eases back and punches it on the up, through extra cover.
Gillespie comes back in style. Maharoof is beaten outside off. Slightly short of length, outside offstump, bit of extra bounce and it straightens a touch and Maharoof pushes at it.
bouncer outside offstump line, swayed away

full in length, on the offstump line, Maharoof drives, in the air, back down the track and it falls short of the diving Gillespie. New Zealand continue to hustle Sri Lanka with some very good fielding
bouncer and ducked under
tossed up, driven past Vettori
turned to square-leg for a single
flighted on middle and leg, Dilshan comes down the track, whips it to midwicket
on the offstump, slow through the air, Dilshan waits, taps it close on the offside and sets off for a quick single
on the offstump line, Maharoof leans forward, defends
And again.
139 kmph. outside the offstump, left alone
short, on the offstump line, Dilshan pulls it to deep square leg
144kmph, on the offstump line, full in length, steered to point
143kmph. slightly short of length, on the offstump line, Maharoof leans forward, pushes it out to cover
140kmph. bouncer and again in the channel outside off, asking the batsman to fetch if from there, Mahroof resists and it goes through to the 'keeper

lost control there. going for a slower one. Ends up as a beamer. Maharoof gets down in a hurry! Bond looks sheepish, apologises. Batsman accepts, umpire doesn't! has a chat with Bond who nods and walks back to the top of the mark
snorter! a screaming bouncer, swayed away
tossed up, on the offstump line, driven to long-off
flatter, on the offstump line, pushed to cover point
well flighted delivery, lands on offstump line, spins away, lefta lone
the last one was 79 kmph, this one is quicker. 96kmph, full and on the leg and middle, tucked away to Fulton, who comes in from the deep squareleg.
on the offstump line, cut to Gillespie at sweeper cover
full in length, just outside offstump, Dilshan leans forward, taps the ball to covers
142kmph, good-length delivery, in the zone outside the offstump, Dilshan covers his offstump, withdraws his bat from the line and the ball sails through to McCullum
fuller, 143kmph, outside offstump, and driven through cover, down to Fulton standing at deep cover
short in length, 136kmph, just outside the offstump, defended to the offside. Maharoof again practises that defensive shot.
pleasing stroke but no run. Maharoof punches on the up but hits straight to Adams at mid-off
flighted delivery, on middle stump line. Dilshan comes down the track, drives to cover

Dilshan has ran him self out. What a blow. New Zealand continue to dazzle on the field. Pushed to cover, Dilshan wants a run, sets off but there is no response from Maharoof. James Marshall, at cover, throws himself to hisleft to make a great stop and then sends in a quick throw to McCullum who flicks it on to the stumps
outside offstump, spins away, left alone
slow through the air, lands outside off and spins away, left alone
leans forward and defends to offside
tossed up on middle and leg, sweep shot attempted, top-edge takes the ball to shortish fineleg
full, on middle and leg,. worked to midwicket
Franklin goes round the stumps, hurls one full and just outside off, Fernando stabs at it, bat away from the body, in an effort to dab it to thirdman, gets a insid-edge on to the pads
bouncer, ducked under
short of length, outside off, run down past slip, good diving stop near the ropes prevents a boundary
driven to long-on
outside offstump, left alone
fired on the offstump line, stabbed away to the offside
on off and middle, pushed back to Vettori
slightly short of length, lands on the offstump line and turns away, Fernando cuts it, but no timing, and the ball rolls to backward point. Drinks.
136 kmph, length-delivery outside off, punched to extra cover
138 kmph, slightly short of length, from round the stumps, honing in on the offstump line, Fernando pushes at it and it runs off the outer edge to thirdman
on the off and middle, worked to midwicket
139 kmph. Full in length, on the middle-stump line, Maharoof turns it past square-leg
138 kmph. Bouncer around the offstump line, ducked under
oh ho! Fernando goes for a slog. No contact. Full in length, outside off, Fernando takes his left foot outside leg, opens his stance and swings but can't get a touch
81kmph, Vettori continues to change his pace. flighted delivery on middle and off, Maharoof goes for a sweep and gets a under-edge on to his pad
98kmph... on the middle, tucked to short fineleg
Another one bites the dust. Loopy delivery, well outside the offstump and Maharoof tries to fetch it from there and attempts a sweep shot. nicks it behind. Bad shot selection.
97 kmph, full and on the leg and middle, turned to midwicket
biffed through covers! Full and wide, Fernando drilled it through the offside ring.
again from round the stumps, but fuller and on the offstump line, Fernando respects the line and the length, steers it to point
fuller, around offstump line, driven to extra cover. Will bring Murali on strike
top-edged over slips! Banged in short and well outside off, Murali backs away and tries to swing it over midwicket and the ball flies high over slips
Hit and giggle! This time Murali connects well and swings a length-delivery over mid-off!
Murali tries to stand and deliver but Taylor, at deep midwicket, dives and delivers. Another swing across the line but Taylor takes his third catch. And then there were just one.
tossed outside off, driven to mid-off
Sri Lanka have collapsed for 112. Tossed up, outside off, sliced straight to backward point. That caps up a dismal show. This is Sri Lanka's lowest total ever against New Zealand. Home and away.

inn2.comm: beaten! Taylor goes for a wild swish outside off.
good delivery. Lands on a length, outside offstump, comes back in, punched to cover
Nonchalantly flicked for a six! It can happen only in these small New Zealand ground. On the legs, McCullum flicks it over, just over Maharoof, at long-leg for maximum.
full and outside off, swatted to wideish mid-off,

What a catch! Dilshan takes a beauty at backward point. Or does he? Taylor is squared-up pushing forward in defence at a delivery slanted away from him. The ball flies off the outer edge and to left of Dilshan who dives to low to his left, scoops up the ball on his left-hand,. it bobs up and Dilshan, now lying on his back, grabs it off the second attempt. Umpires have a chat and give it out.   Replays tell a different story. When the ball bobbed up from the left palm, it touched the grass when Dilshan tried to grab it! Hmm........  The umpires didn't refer it upstairs and that's that
on the offstump line, defended off the front foot
lands on a length, outside off, comes in a touch, pushed towards mid-on
full in length, outside offstump, pushed to mid-off, a misfield and they will get two
on the hips, tries to work it to on side, runs off the pads
Twhack! Short and McCullum murders it past square-leg. Ferocious pull.
full and wide, McCullum tries to drill it through offside ring, misses and is beaten
This time he suceeds. Again full and well outside off, drilled past mid-off
back to the routine. Outside off, short in length, angling away, he is beaten as he tries to force it off the back foot.
one flew over cuckoo's nest! Flicked over long-leg!  He just thrust his left foot out and sent it flying over long leg

Gone! Got im! McCullum perishes, trying to attack. Full and wide, McCullum, doesn't quite lean on to the shot, drives and sends it straight to Chamara Silva at cover. Silva timed his jump perfectly to take a neat catch. NZ three down and game on! We have another 10 minutes before the lunch break
Whistling through the channel outside off, left alone
full in length, on off and middle , comes in a touch, defended off the front foot
full again, on the offstump line, Fulton leans forward, drives to mid-on
outside offstump, no stroke offered, the ball moved after it left the batsman and keeps low. Sangakkara clangs it. They will get a bye

Awesome strike! Not all that short but Fulton swivels off the front foot and murders it over deep midwicket! Runs and ruins, New Zealand continue to dabble with both. Now a six, now a wicket, the musical chair continues
way outside off
pushed across Fulton, who leans forward, shoulders arms
slanted across, full in length, Fulton chooses to let that one go through to the 'keeper
Slapped through midwicket! Poor delivery, again short and Fulton pulls it the boundary.
full in length, well outside off, left alone
much better delivery. Lands on a length, on the middle and off, comes in slightly, pushed towards mid-on
full in length, pushed across, Vettori leans forward and is struck on the front pad but well outside offstump.
Sri Lanka continue to leak runs. Full and wide, drilled, on a bent-knee, through the cover region.
corrects the length, hits the good-length and pushes it across Vettori who shoulders arms
full in length, straight and on the middle stump line, Vettori leans forward, works it across the line, past Chamara Silva at square-leg
Another boundary!  New Zealand have moved on to 49 in no time. Overpitched outside off, driven to left of Muralitharan at mid-off who mis-fields. Should have stopped that.
goes round the stumps, on the stumps, worked to midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven to wide mid-off.
lands on the offstump line, spins away, left alone
lands outside leg, spins in, dabbed to midwicket
Appeal for stumping. But Vettori just about makes it in time. He had dragged his back feet out while going for a sweep shot but had dragged it back just before Sangakkara whipped off the bails
tossed up on middle and leg, swept to long leg
full in length, driven to mid-off

Another wicket! The drama continues at the Jade stadium. Vettori goes for a pull shot, top-edges it over and behind Sangakkara who runs back, waits for the swirling ball to come down and holds a tumbling catch.  Another 64 runs, another 6 wickets!
outside offstump, left alone

The theme of NZ innings continues. Runs and wickets. Full and on the middle stump line, drilled past the bowler. This is one strange game going on. Can't quite understand the harakiri done by both teams. Must be one of those days. Blame the cold weather!
tossed up, lands outside off, turns in, leans forward and pushes it back down the track
tossed up doosra. Nearly had him there. He pushes at it, playing for the spin and the outside edge just squirts past silly point
Another doosra, this time Marshall spots it, waits and dabs it to shortish thirdman
leans forward, defends a offbreak, to the offside
full in length, around off and middle, Fulton leans forward, goes through the line and the ball flies over mid-on. Easy. Now then, we have a four, what will follow next?!
A single. Fulton leans forward to a length-delivery, pushes it towards mid-on
good-length delivery, driven to mid-on
short of length, outside the offstump, Marshall goes back and across, cuts it down to thirdman region
tossed up outside off, sucking the batsman forward and then it straightens, but pushed out past silly point
on the middle stump line, swept with the spin
jaffa! Doosra. Lands on  the off and middle stump line, on a length and spun away. Fulton stretched forward in hope and didn't connect.
slightly short, offbreak, whipped with the spin towards square-leg where Dilshan makes a diving stop
ripping doosra, bemused batsman. Again draws Fulton forward and leaves him bemused, sheepish. Great delivery.
lands on a length, outside the offstump, comes in , defended off the front foot.
143kmph. speared in full on the middle stump line, hint of in drift, worked to right of midwicket
length-delivery, around the offstump line, defended off the front foot
full in length, outside offstump, Fulton leans forward, drives to mid-off
slightly short of length, outside the offstump, Fulton goes for a pull, misses.
tossed up on the middle. leans forward to smother. It was a doosra btw.
lands on the same spot. Not a doosra though. This one spins in the conventional way, past the bat, past the pads and into Sangakkara's gloves

The drama continues! New Zealand lose their fifth wicket. Tossed up on the off and middle stump line, Marshall leans forward, sweeps but fails to keep it down and sends it straight to Dilshan at square-leg. The rollercoaster ride at the Jade stadium is on full swing. Game on still.
tossed up, full and just outside leg, turned to midwicket
lands outside off, on a length, turns in, defended away to the offside.

Huge shout for lbw. Dead plumb. Not given. Searing yorker, right on the middle stump line, Fulton tries to get his left feet out, is struck on the toe and it flies away to first slip where it is palmed off. Reason for not out is revealed. Umpire gives it a run. He thought itwent of the bat.
full and drilled through extra cover.  wickets, appeals and runs... they all keep coming in turns

Would you believe it? Another wicket has gone down on this strange strange day of cricket. And then there were four. Dragged back to the stumps. Short of length, outside off, Marshall stabs at it and ends up killing himself. The ball goes on the top of the middle stump. He tries desperately to prevent the mishap but  the ball beats him.  What drama here!
on the stumps, defended off the front foot
bouncer ......... ducked under
on the middle and leg, turning away, turned round the corner
on the middle, turns in, pushes forward in defense
doosra but too short and it spins outside off, swatted past cover
on the middle, from round the stumps, comes in, pushed away to the on side
back to over the stumps. flatter and quicker, on off and middle, turned to midwicket
tossed up, on middle and leg, pushes forward in defense, the ball spins past the bat and raps him on the pad.
Franklin breaks free. He is good form, both in the Tests and the ODI series. Full and wide, square-driven, in the air, through the offside ring.
Another vital boundary. This time down to third man region. From round the stumps, landed outside off, straightens a touch, Franklin steers it past slips.
slower delivery, ends up as a low full-toss, driven to mid-off
speared in on the middle and leg, pushed to on side. 30 runs to win. 4 wickets in hand. What a bizzare game of cricket this has turned out to be.
short of length, on the middle stump line, defended down the track
ripping offbreak, lands on middle and off, breaks away, left alone
Almost a catch. No man's land. Tossed outside leg, on a length, Franklin goes for a sweep, hits the toe-end, pops up on the leg side but falls in no man's land.
leans forward, defends to silly point
tossed up, too full, driven to mid-off
Super shot. Pressure is released. Fullish, outside offstump, Fulton leans forward and drives it with full face of the bat , between the bowler and Jayasuriya, at mid-on.
A bouncer, ducked under.
short of length, on the offstump line, defended away to cover
full in length, outside the offstump, Fulton comes forward, drives to cover
ooh..... lands on a length, outside the offstump. Fulton leaves it on the length but to his surprise, the ball jagged back in sharply and it went over, just over, the top of the offstump.
full in length, around the offstump line, pushed away to mid-off
Franklin gets a boundary. 21 runs to win now. Flighted up, on the offstump line, bit too full and Franklin leans forward to caress it elegantly between the bowler and mid-off. His third boundary.
on the offstump line, he leans forward, steers it past point
doosra, lands around offstump line, goes away, Fulton picks it, lets it go
offbreak this time, on the middle stump line, turned to leg slip
slightly short of length, outside off, coming in, punched to extra cover. Perera gives the chase. They will get two
on the off and middle, breaks in, worked to midwicket
short of length, on the hips, turned to midwicket
lands on a length, around the offstump, holds its line, he leans forward, punches it back to the bowler. No run.

speared in on the pads, Franklin tries to turn it around the corner. He ended up turning, the ball beat the bat, hit the pad, ran away towards shortish fineleg, Will get a single though. 17 runs required. Four wickets for Sri Lanka.
In the zone outside offstump, left alone

Poor delivery and Fulton makes him pay. Fulton rings the room service and Perera serves him with a full and wide one, drilled through cover. 13 runs now. New Zealand are close. Surely, they can't mess up now. or can they?
tossed up, outside offstump, pushed past sillypoint
on the off and middle, pushed to point
offbreak, around offstump, Franklin pushes forward in defense, the ball runs to backward point
Wide! Murali goes for a doosra but it goes spinning down leg side. Easy decision.
beaten! so close to that outside edge. Tossed up, lands around offstump, Franklin pushes at it and is beaten as the offbreak spins past his bat
around offstump again, steered to the offside
length-delivery, lands on the offstump line, goes on with the angle. dabbed down to thirdman. Just 11 runs now.
speared in full. 142 kmph. at the pads, Franklin pushes at it, and the ball raps him on the pads and bobs away to the on side
full and on the middle stump line, it goes on with the angle. Franklin leans forward, brings his bat around his front pad, pushes it out to Jayasuriya at mid-on
banged in short of length, outside offstump, Franklin is offbalance when trying to force it off the back foot, ends up pushing it to cover
Another shortish and wide outside offstump, cut past point
full in length, on the leg and middle, worked to midwicket.
from round the stumps, tossed up, lands outside leg, a doosra, Fulton leans forward, pushes it to the on side. only 8 runs needed
Almost holed up toe the deep backward square-leg. Tossed up on middle and leg, Franklin sweeps, in the air, one bounce to that man in the deep. New Zealand inch closer.
They are doing it in singles here. Tossed up on the middle stump, a offbreak, Fulton leans forward, turns it around the corner, with the spin.
doosra and Franklin is struck in the pad, pushing forward in defense. Point of impact was outside the offstump.
flatter, on the middle and offstump line, Franklin goes down on his front knee, attempts to sweep, doesn't connect and the ball runs of the back thigh,,, to the offside.
in the zone outside offstump, Fulton goes for a drive with a opened face of the bat and is beaten.
banged in short and well outside the offstump, swayed away without any fuss. Surely, Fernando will go for his yorker at some point
Screaming pull shot for six! Fulton has won the game for New Zealand!  Banged in short, and Fulton swivels off his front foot and murders it over deep midwicket. Game over!
